title: Analysis by mass: an introduction to the mass spectrometer
creator_credit: Associated Electrical Industries Film Unit, Michael Clarke and Brian Kaufman
brief_description: Structure of atom and nucleus; definition of isotopes; principle of the mass spectograph, explained by a model in which balls of different masses are deflected by different amounts in a constant magnetic field. Construction of a mass spectrometer. Uses of mass spectrometry: to identify molecules, determine molecular structure, measure impurities, analyse gases in breath, radioactive dating of rocks.
